result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Lavel Holt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary (Home Invasion), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
HEARING AUGUST 18, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR. 19.
***8-18-15, Restitution Hearing, Parties have stipulated to restitution of $500.00 to Jose V. joint and several.  Amounts to be paid as previously ordered from 25% of the defendant's prison accounts.  Any unpaid amounts to convert to a civil judgment.

Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Restitution to be determined at a later date; all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge. All applicable fees of supervision. Bail to apply.
If revoked, all to be paid through collectin by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never pssess a firearm; and that he may  not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No possession, consumption, selling, distributin of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with the victim named in the complaint or their residence.
No contact with the coactor.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed neccessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED until 7/10/2015 by 5:00 p.m.
The first two months straight time. The last five months at the Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Lavel Holt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Restitution Refund Packets
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Jose V. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26212011 in court 1x on 8/18/15.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Willie Lavel Holt not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Parties have stipulated to restitution of $500.00 to Jose V. joint and several.  Amounts to be paid as previously ordered from 25% of the defendant's prison accounts.  Any unpaid amounts to convert to a civil judgment.
Due to clerical error, DEFENDANT'S DOB now showing. corrected w/o file.
DOC request for amended JOC to include defendant's birth date.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Harry W

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 9 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision/Probation:
- 7 MONTHS condition time, first 2 months STRAIGHT TIME, last 5 months at the day reporting center.  Court stayed commencement until 07/10/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the victim named in the complaint or their residence.
- No contact with the co-actor
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution to be determined at a later date; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-   Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Case adjourned for restitution hearing.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.

Defendant Willie Lavel Holt in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Willie Lavel Holt in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defese requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Original Information filed.

Defendant Willie Lavel Holt in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Irene Parthum for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Arraignment, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  The State plans to file the Information off the record. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Arraignment scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM016335  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-27-15

Defendant Willie Lavel Holt in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Ron Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Arraignment scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jose V. and Melissa R. (residents/ownder of 605 E. Auer, Milwaukee, WI).

Defendant Willie Lavel Holt in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Willie Lavel Holt in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
